org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division.

body.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
THE PETITION OF K. GREGORY, . ALOSHIN, I. RIABOFF, P. NEANILIN, K. EMELIN, J. ORLOFF, G. YAKIMOFF AND P. YAKIMOFF FOR A WRIT OF "HABEAS CORPUS".
TO THE HONORABLE JUDGES OF SAID COURT.
YOUR PETITIONERS BEING FIRST DULY SWORN ON OATH, EACH FOR HIMSELF ALLEGES AS FOLLOWS, TO-WIT.

FIRST, THAT ALL OF SAID YOUR PETITIONERS ARE BETAINED AT THE UNITED STATES DETENTION STATION IN THE CITY OF SEATTLE, KING COUNTY, STATE OF WASHINGTON by the United States Commissioner of Immigration, contrary to the statutes in such cases made and provided

Second, That all of said persons are whiet and above the age of Twenty years of Age, and in the enjoyment of good health, able bodied and able to take care of themselves, and duly supplied with ready money to meet all the requirements of the Law of the U.S., and that they are not contract laborers, and they are not seeking entrance to the U.S. in pursuance of any contract of labor made with any one.

Third, That they are seeking to enter the U.S. of their free will and good faith intending to make the U.S. their permanant residence and home and fully intending to obey and comply with all the laws of the U.S.

Fourth, That all your petitioners were born in Russia, that they have left Russia with their own free will, and not by any reason that they have commited any offence against the laws of Russia and that they are coming here in hopes of better their conditions inder the beneficient laws of the U.S.
Fifth. That they have paid their transportation to the U.S. with thier own money.

Sixth. That your petitioners are nto held by said Immigration Commissioner upon any final process issued by a court of common jurisdiction, nor held upon any process or order for any cempt of any court, officer, or body having authority
to commit or hold them, nor upon any warrant issued by any court of this State, upon indictment, or information in this State, nor is there any lawful or valid reason for detention of your petitioners.
Seventh. Your petitioners are held by the said Immigration Commissioner upon the alleged grounds as follows, to-wit.
1st. That there many Russians in the City of Seattle out of work.

2nd. That they might become a public burden, but your petitionres avere that they are able to secure and save harmless the U.S. from any damage of any kind or nature whatsoever, arising from inability of your petitioners to support and take care of themselves and that they are amply able and willing and intend to be good and selfe supporting residents of the U.S.

First, A. Writ of "Habeas Corpus" issue out of this Court directed to H.M. White the said Immigration Commissioner in whose costudy your petitioners now are, commanding and requiring said H.M. White to have the bodies of your petitioners before this Court on some special and convinient day to be determined by this Court then and there to show cause, why these petitioners are detained of thier liberties, and why they should not be forthwith and immediately discharged from said costudy.
2nd. That thhe pending of return of this writ at the date so to be fixed by this court to assure thier appearance at the said return day.
3rd. That your petitioner be discharged fronm said costudy that they have such other and further relief as thie court may seem just.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 12th day of January, 1914.
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington residing at Seattle.
